synthesis_conditions.description: Formed by continuous linkage of 2,6-ndc and ZnII-o-phen units with DMF occupying the void space.
Single-component vapor adsorption isotherms recorded at 298 K for C8 isomers.
Vapor diffusion kinetics measurement for xylenes in their vapor phase.
Liquid-phase separation by fixed-bed column chromatography and batch experiments for C8 isomers.
In-situ reaction methodology for synthesizing and characterizing the xylenes, St, and Tol encapsulated PCPs as single crystals.
Removal of guest DMF from the nanospace rearranges the structure in a closely packed material, resulting in a 21.3% reduction in cell volume compared to the parent structure 1.
Filling up of the nanospace with guests like aromatic amines or CO2 regenerates the porous structure, similar to 1.
